conclusion: Objects A and B start moving from the same location in the same direction.
The graph shows the velocity of objects A and B over time.
Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity with respect to time.
The slope of the velocity-time graph at any point gives the acceleration at that point.
At \( t_1 \), the slope of the tangent line for object A is steeper than the slope of the tangent line for object B.
Since the slopes at \( t_1 \) are different, the accelerations of the two objects are not the same.
No, the two objects do not have the same acceleration at time \( t_1 \).
